result.execSummary:
The defendant Samual R Shamie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Illinois.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant to obtain High School diploma. Employment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Defendant to continue with outpatient program and comply with terms. Services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samual R Shamie

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Bail/bond hearing on November 4, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 3, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Samual R Shamie in court with attorney Robert William Keller.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Offer has been made.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 27, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   Do not drive at all in the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Samual R Shamie in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Samual R Shamie in custody.  James D. Newlun appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.    Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 09:00 am.
